sen.j: 明峰素哲（めいほうそてつ、建治3年（1277年）- 観応元年/正平 (日本)5年3月28日 (旧暦)（1350年5月5日））は、鎌倉時代後期から南北朝時代 (日本)にかけての曹洞宗の僧。
sen.e: Meihosotetsu (1277 - May 5, 1350) was a Soto sect Buddhist monk from the latter half of the Kamakura period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
Meihosotetsu (1277 - May 5, 1350) was a Soto sect Buddhist monk from the late Kamakura period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
sen.cmt: 「鎌倉時代後期」は「the later half of」も可能ですが「the late」のほうが一般的のようですので（どちらも用語集にあります）後者を採用しました。
sen.e: Meihosotetsu (1277 - May 5, 1350) was a Soto sect Buddhist monk from the late Kamakura period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
His secular surname was the Togashi clan.
His secular surname was Togashi.
sen.cmt: この場合の｢富樫氏」はclan不要ではないかと思われます。
sen.e: His secular surname was Togashi.
His real personal name was Sotetsu.
His real personal name was Sotetsu.
His real personal name was Sotetsu.
His pseudonym was Myoho.
His pseudonym was Myoho.
His pseudonym was Myoho.

sen.j: 当初比叡山に上って出家して受戒したが、その後鎌倉建仁寺に移り、さらに加賀国大乗寺に瑩山紹瑾をたずねてその門下となった。
sen.e: He at first took the tonsure and was ordained as a Buddhist priest by receiving the commandments of Buddhism at Mt. Hiei; later, moved to Kenninji Temple in Kamakura; further, he visited Keizan Jokin at Daijoji Temple in Kaga Province and became a disciple of Jokin.

He at first took the tonsure and was ordained as a Buddhist priest by receiving the commandments of Buddhism at Mt. Hiei, then moved to Kenninji Temple in Kamakura and further, visited Keizan Jokin at Daijoji Temple in Kaga Province to become a disciple of Jokin.
sen.cmt: 「；」をなくしてコンマでつなぎ、「and became」を「to become」にしました。
sen.e: He at first took the tonsure and was ordained as a Buddhist priest by receiving the commandments of Buddhism at Mt. Hiei, then moved to Kenninji Temple in Kamakura and further, visited Keizan Jokin at Daijoji Temple in Kaga Province to become a disciple of Jokin.

sen.j: 長い期間参禅しその印可を受けた。
sen.e: He practiced Zen meditation for a long time and received Inka, authorization to teach.
He practiced Zen meditation for a long period and received Inka, authorization to teach.
sen.cmt: 「long time」ですと座禅の１回が長時間といったニュアンスになりかねないので「period」にしました。
sen.e: He practiced Zen meditation for a long period and received Inka, authorization to teach.

sen.j: その後加賀国伝燈寺の恭翁運良に参禅し、大乗寺・永光寺の住持を歴任した後、越中国の光禅寺を創建して第1世となった。
sen.e: Later, he practiced Zen meditation under Kyoou Unryo in Dentoji Temple in Kaga Province; then successively served as the chief priest at Taijoji Temple and Yokoji Temple; and founded Kozenji Temple in Ecchu Province and became the first head priest there.

Later, he practiced Zen meditation under Kyoou Unryo in Dentoji Temple in Kaga Province, served as the chief priest at Taijoji Temple and Yokoji Temple successively, and founded Kozenji Temple in Ecchu Province to become the first head priest there.
sen.cmt: 「；」をなくしてコンマでつなぎ、「and became」を「to become」にしました。
sen.e: Later, he practiced Zen meditation under Kyoou Unryo in Dentoji Temple in Kaga Province, served as the chief priest at Taijoji Temple and Yokoji Temple successively, and founded Kozenji Temple in Ecchu Province to become the first head priest there.
